meanings.definition: The ability to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
meanings.sent1: Her versatility in playing multiple musical instruments impressed everyone at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The versatility of the Swiss Army knife makes it a handy tool for various tasks.
meanings.sent3: The robot's versatility in cooking, cleaning, and even dancing made it the star of the show.
meanings.sent4: His versatility on the basketball court earned him the nickname 'The All-Rounder'.
meanings.sent5: The actress's versatility in portraying different characters left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to turn easily from one task to another.
meanings.sent1: The chef's versatility in preparing both savory dishes and desserts amazed the guests.
meanings.sent2: The versatility of the gymnast was evident as she effortlessly switched between different routines.
meanings.sent3: The cat's versatility in napping in various spots around the house never failed to amuse the family.
meanings.sent4: The politician's versatility in addressing different issues helped him gain widespread support.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's versatility in competing in multiple sports made him a true all-rounder.
